3FS.F.summary: Kalray S.A. provides low-power and time-critical processor solutions in France. It offers massively parallel manycore array processors. The company also provides data center solutions, including Kalray Target Controller, a family of storage solutions offering an all-in-one system to build optimized NVMe-of just a bunch of flash; and TurboBoost, a solution to offload the encryption/decryption operations involved in secure communications. In addition, it offers software development kits, such as AccessCore that allows customers to program the massively parallel processor array using standard languages comprising C/C++/OpenCL, programming models, APIs, and tools; and Kalray Neural Network, a tool for implementing deep learning networks on the massively parallel processor array, as well as other software and tools. Further, the company provides PCIe and PCIe acceleration boards for storage, networking, cryptography applications; and development platforms. It serves autonomous vehicle, aerospace/avionic, artificial intelligence, data storage, data networking, and computer vision markets. The company is headquartered in Montbonnot Saint Martin, France.

6SQB.F.summary: Sequans Communications S.A. develops and provides 5G and 4G chips and modules for massive, broadband, and critical Internet of Things (IoT) markets. For 5G/4G massive IoT applications, the company provides a comprehensive product portfolio based on its flagship Monarch LTE-M/NB-IoT and Calliope Cat 1 chip platforms featuring low power consumption, a set of integrated functionalities, and deployment capability. For 5G/4G broadband and critical IoT applications, Sequans Communications S.A. offers a product portfolio based on its Cassiopeia Cat 4/Cat 6 4G and high-end Taurus 5G chip platforms optimized for residential, enterprise, and industrial applications. The company was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Paris, France with additional offices in the United States, the United Kingdom, Israel, Hong Kong, Singapore, Taiwan, South Korea, and China.
